Headlines: Markets snap two-day gain; settle lower
Description: Equity indices end lower on Oct 31 due to foreign fund outflows, Middle East tensions and US Fed rate decision; Sensex down 237.72 pts & Nifty 61.30 pts; Major laggards: M&M, Airtel, ICICI Bank, IndusInd Bank, RIL, Axis Bank & HDFC Bank; Major gainers: Titan, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Asian Paints, HCL Tech, Tech Mahindra, NTPC, Nestle and Power Grid; Asian markets mixed, European markets in green and US markets higher

Headlines: Ed Sheeran’s upcoming concert buoys Kotak Bank’s credit card applications: Report
Description: Ed Sheeran concert in Mumbai: Ticket sales for the show in general went live starting October 27 at 3 pm IST on BookMyShow and Ed Sheeran's official website.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank’s Dipak Gupta Gets RBI Nod For Tenure Extension
Description:
The Reserve Bank of India has approved the extension of appointment of Dipak Gupta as interim managing director and chief executive officer of Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. till Dec. 31.

In its quarterly earnings on Oct. 2, the private bank had announced that Ashok Vaswani will take charge as the new MD and CEO, latest by January 2024, , as per an exchange filing. As per the last appointment notice, Gupta's term was to end on Nov. 1.

Gupta will continue to serve as the head of the bank till Vaswani assumes charge, the notification said.

Headlines: Kotak’s New Outsider CEO Seen As Break From Billionaire Founder
Description: India’s central bank backed an outsider with little experience in the country to lead Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd., surprising analysts and senior management and sending its stock falling.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q2 Results Review: Smooth Succession Of New CEO Will Be Crucial
Description:
The appointment of Ashok Vaswani, an external candidate, as managing director and chief executive officer of Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. has raised concerns among investors about a potential change in the growth strategy of the bank, according to analysts.

"While a change in CEO was expected, an external candidate would raise questions on any potential changes in strategy, delays in major new initiatives (e.g., the IDBI deal), etc.," Bernstein Research said in a note.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q2 Results Review - Strong Quarter; MD, CEO Approved By RBI: Prabhudas Lilladher
Description:
Kotak Mahindra Bank is a solid banking franchise with strong balance sheet, prudent credit practices and attractive return on asset profile of 2.2-2.3% (ICICI Bank Ltd. 2.0%). However, over last two-three years, earnings quality of ICICI Bank has been superior with likely core return on equity at 17% (Kotak Mahindra Bank 14%). 

We trim multiple to 3.3 times (3.5 times earlier) but roll forward to September-25 core adjusted book value, maintaining SOTP based target price at Rs 2,250. Retain ‘Buy’.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q2 Results Review - Margin Under Pressure While Bank Gets New CEO: Yes Securities
Description:
Total deposits were up 23% YoY driven by term deposits. Activmoney deposits are up 28%, with some retail savings account shifting to Activmoney deposits. 

The cost of Activmoney is still than that of term deposits with card rates for term deposits being seven-ish in the one-three year bucket. The current account and savings account ratio stood at 48.3%. Management alluded to further margin decline but not as sharp as that seen in Q2: Ashok Vaswani has been approved by the RBI as the new MD and CEO of Kotak Mahindra Bank:

Headlines: Meet Ashok Vaswani, the corporate veteran who will succeed Uday Kotak at Kotak Mahindra Bank
Description: Ashok Vaswani will succeed Uday Kotak, who has quit as the MD of the bank in September this year.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank To Apply For Extension Of Dipak Gupta’s Term
Description:
Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. will apply to the Reserve Bank of India for extending the term of interim managing director and chief executive officer, Dipak Gupta.

The bank's management announced this in the post Q2 earnings analyst call on Saturday.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q2 results: Total income rise 36% to Rs 13,507.40 cr, PAT surges by 24%
Description: Analysts at StoxBox Brokerage had predicted Kotak Mahindra Bank to report 24.2 per cent rise in profit at Rs 3,205 crore on 24.7 per cent rise in NII at Rs 6,358 crore.

Headlines: ‘I am delighted’: Uday Kotak after RBI approves Ashok Vaswani as new CEO for Kotak Mahindra Bank
Description: This appointment comes in the wake of the departure of veteran banker and co-founder Uday Kotak, who stepped down from his position last month.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q2 Net Profit Rises 24% To Rs 3,191 Cr - News18
Description: Its total income during the July-September period grew to Rs 13,507 crore against Rs 9,925 crore in the year-ago quarter,

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q2 Results: Net Profit Rises 23.5% On Higher Core Income
Description:
Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd.'s second-quarter profit rose meeting analyst estimates on higher core income even as provisions jumped.

The private lender's standalone net profit rose 23.5% to Rs 3,190 crore in the quarter ended September, according to its exchange filing. Analysts polled by Bloomberg estimated a profit of Rs 3,278 crore for the quarter.

Sequentially, the standalone net profit fell 8%.

Headlines: ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Yes Bank Q2 Results Today — Earnings Estimates
Description: ICICI Bank Ltd. will announce its results for the quarter ended September on Saturday.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Gets RBI Nod For Acquisition Of Sonata Finance
Description: The RBI has allowed Kotak to make Sonata as its business correspondent subsidiary and the entity will now be a wholly-owned subsidiary of Kotak Mahindra Bank.

Headlines: Markets continue to fall on weak global trends, soaring crude oil prices
Description: Equity benchmarks fall on weak global cues, rising crude prices; FIIs offload equities worth Rs 1,093.47 cr. Sensex down 320.63 pts; Nifty at 19,518.70. HUL, HCL Tech, ITC, Power Grid, Bajaj Fin, UltraTech Cement major laggards. Nestle, Tata Motors, Kotak Mahindra Bank, IndusInd Bank gainers. US 10-yr yield, West Asia tensions headwinds for equity mkt.

Headlines: RBI Imposes Penalty On ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank For Violation Of Norms - News18
Description: The Reserve Bank on Tuesday said it has imposed a penalty or Rs 12.19 crore on ICICI Bank and Rs 3.95 crore on Kotak Mahindra Bank

Headlines: RBI imposes penalty on ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank for violation of norms
Description: RBI said it has imposed a penalty or ₹12.19 crore on ICICI Bank and ₹3.95 crore on Kotak Mahindra Bank for non-compliance of certain regulatory norms

Headlines: Sensex snaps two-day rally
Description: Volatile trade on BSE Sensex reverses two-day rally due to IT stocks' selling. Nifty also declines 0.09%. TCS results mixed, Infosys & HCL Tech down. Profit taking in Bajaj Fin, Nestle, Kotak Bank, SBI, Airtel, L&T & Asian Paints weigh on index. Maruti up 1.73% on strong sales. Asian markets, incl. Japan, China & HK, up. FIIs net sellers, offload ₹421.77 cr.

Headlines: Chennai man accidentally receives Rs 753 cr after transferring Rs 2,000 to friend
Description: Muhammad Idris, who is a pharmacy worker, transferred the money to his friend through the Kotak Mahindra Bank mobile app. However, when he checked his account balance, which was earlier Rs 3,000, he was shocked to see that it had increased to Rs 753 crore.

Headlines: Axis Bank, IDBI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank Revises Fixed Term Deposit Rates; Check Latest Update - News18
Description: FD interest rates are updated by banks on a regular basis.

Headlines: ‘If my son performs, he may have an opportunity to head Kotak Mahindra Bank’: Uday Kotak
Description: Jay Kotak, who joined Kotak Mahindra Bank seven years ago, currently serves as the Vice President and co-head of Kotak Mahindra Bank's digital banking solution Kotak811

Headlines: Avoid Frequent Interference With Settlement Commission Orders: Supreme Court
Description:
Unsettling reasoned orders of the Settlement Commission may erode the confidence of bonafide taxpayers, thereby leading to multiplicity of litigation where settlement is possible, the Supreme Court has said. 
It said so in an appeal filed by Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. against an order of the Karnataka High Court. 
The dispute pertained to a tax reassessment proceeding initiated against Kotak after the bank had allegedly concealed its income.

Headlines: BQ Banking Unlimited | Advancing The Banking Ecosystem
Description: BQ Banking Unlimited | Advancing The Banking Ecosystem #BQBankingUnlimited | Axis Bank's Rajiv Anand and Kotak Mahindra Bank's Shanti Ekambaram talk about the advancement of the banking ecosystem, in conversation with Vishwanath Nair.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty fall after record-breaking rally; investors await Fed rate decision
Description: On Sept. 18, Sensex & Nifty ended lower after 11-day rally due to weak global markets & caution ahead of Fed's rate decision. HDFC Bank, Bharti Airtel, Infosys, UltraTech Cement, Tata Steel, Wipro, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Reliance Industries, Tech Mahindra & JSW Steel were major laggards. Asian markets ended mixed, while European & US markets ended in negative territory. FIIs bought equities worth Rs 164.42 crore. Brent crude rose 0.39% to $94.30/barrel.

Headlines: RBI Approves Dipak Gupta’s Appointment As Kotak Mahindra Bank’s Interim MD And CEO - News18
Description: Dipak Gupta completed engineering in electronics from Banaras Hindu University in 1983 and went on to pursue his master’s diploma in management from IIM Ahmedabad in 1985.

Headlines: RBI Approves Two Months For Dipak Gupta’s Tenure As Interim CEO At Kotak Mahindra Bank
Description: RBI's approval for Gupta is till November 2, even as the board approved his tenure till December 31

Headlines: Trade Talk | Uday Kotak Resigns, What’s Next For Kotak Mahindra Bank?
Description: Trade Talk | Uday Kotak Resigns, What's Next For Kotak Mahindra Bank? Ventura Securities' Vinit Bolinjkar talks about what next for Kotak Mahindra Bank, in conversation with Alex and Hiral.

Headlines: Succession at Kotak Mahindra Bank: Dipak Gupta, Shanti Ekambaram, and K.V.S. Manian in running to succeed Uday Kotak
Description: The board has named Dipak Gupta, the most senior professional, as the interim MD & CEO, for a three-month period until December this year. Kotak's term as MD&CEO was supposed to end in December.

Headlines: Uday Kotak resigns as CEO of Kotak Mahindra Bank
Description: Uday Kotak has resigned as MD and CEO of Kotak Mahindra Bank. Dipak Gupta will take over duties until Decembere 31. Kotak's resignation comes four months ahead of planned retirement.

Headlines: Uday Kotak Resigns As Kotak Mahindra Bank MD & CEO, Dipak Gupta Takes Interim Role - News18
Description: As an interim arrangement, Dipak Gupta, the joint managing director, will carry out the duties of the MD and CEO

Headlines: Uday Kotak Resigns As MD And CEO Of Kotak Mahindra Bank
Description: Uday Kotak resigns as MD & CEO of Kotak Mahindra Bank four months ahead of his retirement. Joint managing director Dipak Gupta will serve as acting MD & CEO until a new CEO is appointed. Kotak, who founded the bank in 2002, said in his resignation letter that it is time to move on.

Headlines: UPI-Digital Rupee Interoperability: Kotak Mahindra Bank Adds Feature In App - News18
Description: CBDC-UPI interoperability aims to ease day-to-day customer convenience; with this,  e₹ app users can now scan any QR code at merchants to make payments for groceries, daily expenses

Description: From the Sensex pack, Larsen & Toubro, Mahindra & Mahindra, HDFC Bank, Sun Pharma, Maruti, Kotak Mahindra Bank, IndusInd Bank, Tata Steel and State Bank of India were among the gainers

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty pare early gains; trade lower on sustained foreign fund outflows
Description: Mkt indices open higher but pare gains; Tata Steel, Axis Bank, JSW Steel, Infosys, TCS, RIL gain; Jio Fin Svcs, Airtel, ITC, Kotak Mahindra Bank, IndusInd Bank, M&M lag. Tokyo, HK up; Seoul, Shanghai down. US mkt mixed. No triggers. FIIs offload equities. BSE ekes out marginal gain; Nifty inched up.

Headlines: Markets pare early gains; trade lower amid continuous foreign fund outflows
Description: Mumbai bourses open on a high but pare gains; Sensex down 76.55 pts. Nifty at 19,376.35. Tata Steel, Axis Bank, JSW Steel, Infosys, TCS, RIL, UltraTech Cement & NTPC gainers; Jio Financial Services, Bharti Airtel, ITC, Kotak Mahindra Bank, IndusInd Bank & M&M laggards. Tokyo & Hong Kong up, Seoul & Shanghai down. No immediate triggers, investors wait for U.S. data. FIIs offload equities worth ₹495.17 cr. BSE benchmark up 3.94 pts, Nifty up 2.85 pts.

Headlines: Kotak FYN aims to have one lakh customer base by March 2024
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. plans to have 1 lakh customers on its digital platform, Kotak FYN, by year end. 5.5 lakh trade transactions valued at ₹26,100 crore have been recorded in the first five months. Roadshows in major cities are being conducted to create awareness and target MNCs, NBFCs, insurance firms, mutual funds and IT services in Chennai.

Headlines: Markets snap 2-day winning run; Sensex slumps nearly 390 pts on weak global cues
Description: Equity benchmarks Sensex & Nifty close in negative territory, tracking losses in index majors. Biggest loser ITC, followed by Power Grid, Reliance Industries, Larsen & Toubro, Nestle, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Bajaj Finance & JSW Steel. Asian & European markets trading lower; US markets ended in negative territory. FIIs bought equities worth ₹722.76 crore.

Headlines: Tilaknagar Industries prepays debt to Edelweiss ARC, concludes financial revamp
Description: Tilaknagar Industries has successfully concluded its financial restructuring exercise, repaying ₹176.22 cr. of restructured debt to EARC. Funds raised from Kotak Mahindra Bank & internal accruals enabled the prepayment. Financial costs have declined, leading to cash flow generation. Aiming to be net-debt free by Mar '25.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty decline in early trade on weak cues from Asian markets
Description: Equity indices decline in early trade, extending previous day's weak momentum. RBI's hawkish stance & cash reduction announcement weigh on sentiment. Major laggards: JSW Steel, HUL, ICICI Bank, NTPC, IndusInd Bank, Tata Steel, ITC & Kotak Mahindra Bank. FIIs bought equities worth Rs 331.22 cr. Focus on IIP numbers post RBI policy. Global oil benchmark Brent crude down 0.02%. BSE Sensex down 219.52 pts, NSE Nifty down 64.2 pts. RBI's hawkish stance & cash reduction announcement weigh on equity indices, major laggards incl. JSW Steel, HUL, ICICI Bank, NTPC, IndusInd Bank, Tata Steel, ITC & Kotak Mahindra Bank. FIIs bought equities worth Rs 331.22 cr. Focus on IIP numbers post RBI policy. Global oil benchmark Brent crude down 0.02%.

Description: A news report said Reserve Bank of India wants Kotak Mahindra Bank to pick an outsider as next chief executive

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank refutes media reports, says no communication from RBI on CEO succession
Description: Private sector lender Kotak Mahindra Bank on Monday said it has not received any communication from the Reserve Bank on the succession of its executive officer (CEO). The bank was responding to a media report, which said the RBI is nudging the bank to appoint an outsider as a successor.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Says No Communication From RBI On CEO Succession - News18
Description: It comes after a media report says the RBI is nudging Kotak Mahindra Bank to select someone outside the lender's ranks to succeed billionaire founder Uday Kotak as next CEO

Headlines: Bank Nifty prediction today – July 31, 2023: Might extend the correction
Description: Bank Nifty index opened today’s session with a gap-up at 45,546 versus July 28’s close of 45,468. Bandhan Bank is the top gainer by advancing 2.9 per cent and Kotak Mahindra Bank, down 0.7 per cent, is the weakest in the index so far.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty close higher on foreign fund inflows, rally in US equities
Description: Sensex & Nifty bounce back Weds. after buying in infra, banking & oil shares. L&T posts 36% rise in net profit. BSE Sensex up 351.49 pts & Nifty 97.70 pts. Major gainers: L&T, ITC, Reliance, Sun Pharma, Kotak Bank, Axis Bank, Infosys & SBI. Asian markets, Europe & US end in red/positive. FIIs buy equities worth ₹1,088.76 crore.

Headlines: ICICI Bank shares may outperform Nifty Bank; Kotak Bank, SBI and PNB may do well
Description: The RSI momentum indicator is currently trading at 70 level. This bullish momentum will continue as the index is showing strength on the weekly chart.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank shares decline nearly 4% after earnings announcement
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank’s shares declined nearly 4 per cent as its June quarter results failed to impress investors. The stock dropped on both BSE and NSE, becoming the biggest laggard among sensex and nifty components. The bank reported a substantial 67 per cent year-on-year jump in standalone net income at ₹3,452 crore. On a consolidated level, the profit grew 51 per cent to ₹4,150 crore, with net interest income increasing 33 per cent.

Headlines: Bank Nifty prediction today – July 24, 2023: Bias is bullish. Go long
Description: Bank Nifty index is trading marginally higher at 46,136, with a bullish bias supported by strong demand in the 46,000-45,900 region. Kotak Mahindra Bank and Au Small Finance are down, while IDFC First Bank outperforms. The outlook remains positive for a rise to 46,600, but a break below 45,900 may bring downward pressure to 45,750. Traders can go long with stop-loss and exit strategies detailed for potential gains. Supports at 46,000 and 46,920, resistances at 46,300 and 46,500.

Headlines: Gift Nifty indicates a downward bias at open for benchmarks
Description: Domestic mkt to open sluggish on Mon; ICICI Bank & Kotak Mahindra Bank post good Q1 numbers. Volatility expected to increase as July derivative contracts expire. Central banks to be busy on rate decisions. Nifty may cross 20K-mark this week despite weak numbers from index heavyweights. FPI flows into India continue, but rising valuations a concern. Equity mkt trended higher last week, buoyed by FII money & improved sentiments. Earnings season & FII flows to hold sway over mkt; some profit booking likely.

Headlines: Kotak Bank Q1 PAT up 67% on strong NII, other income growth
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank posts 67% y-o-y rise in Q1 FY24 net profit to ₹3,452 cr. NII up 33%, NIM at 5.57%. Fees & services income up 20%. Unsecured retail advances up to 10.7% of net advances. Slippages at ₹1,205 cr, recoveries & upgrades at ₹692 cr. Gross NPA ratio at 1.77%, net NPA at 0.40%. NIM to moderate in coming qtrs, loan growth seen in high teens.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q1 results: Net profit surges 67% to Rs 3,452 cr, but asset quality weakens
Description: Its asset quality depleted from Q4 in FY23. Its gross NPA was at Rs 6,587.43 crore in Q1 FY24 as compared to Rs 6,418.67 in Q4 FY23.

Headlines: ICICI Bank, YES Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank Q1 FY24 results today: What is expected?
Description: Analysts are expecting YES Bank to report a growth in net interest income (NIIs) on a year-on-year (YoY) basis, while its quarter-on-quarter numbers (QoQ) may remain subdued.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank’s 67% profit jump beats expectations
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank reported a 67% YoY rise in net profit for Q1, driven by higher net interest income & loan growth. Net interest income rose 33% to ₹6,234 crore, while loans grew 19% & deposits rose 22%. Asset quality was stable, with gross NPA ratio at 1.77% & net NPA ratio at 0.40%.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q1 Results: PAT Jumps 67% To Rs 3,452 Crore, NII Up 33% - News18
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q1 Results: Its net interest income during April-June 2023 increases 33 per cent to Rs 6,234 crore, compared with Rs 4,697 crore in the year-ago period

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q1 Results: Net Profit Rises 66.6%
Description: Private sector lender Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. saw a rise in net profit for the April-June quarter, due to higher core income and sharp rise in other non-fund based income.

Headlines: Attrition rates in private banks jump to over 30% on increased competition
Description: Most players such as Axis Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank and HDFC Bank have reported an increase in the turnover rates

Headlines: Uday Kotak To Step Down As Kotak Mahindra Bank MD; Know His Education And Personal Life - News18
Description: Uday Kotak started a bill discounting business in 1985 with an initial investment of Rs 10,000 which later turned into Kotak Mahindra Finance Ltd.

Headlines: Banking stocks help markets to scale new heights, Sensex rises 0.8%
Description: Banking stocks drove Sensex & Nifty to new heights on Mon, with S&P BSE Sensex rising 0.8% to 66,589.93 pts & Nifty-50 to 19,711.45 pts. Top gainers incl. SBI (2.8%), Wipro (2.54%), Reliance (2.10%), HDFC Bank (2.07%) & Kotak Bank (1.45%). Positive momentum likely to continue, possibly challenging 20000 pts in near term. IT & Metal sectors strong last week, focus shifting to banking this week.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank’s CEO Reports Re 1 Salary for 2022-23, Sets Example - News18
Description: As indicated by the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, Kotak's estimated net worth is approximately $13.4 billion, reaffirming his significant financial standing.

Headlines: Kotak Bank’s employee turnover rises to 46% FY23 from 29% FY21
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank's employee turnover rate rose to 45.9% in FY23, with almost equal attrition for male and female employees. 58.2% of the workforce left in the below 30 years age group. The bank hired 32,080 new employees in the under 30 years age group and 14,614 in the 30-50-year bracket. 67.6% of the new hires were female. Axis Bank's attrition rate also rose to 34.8% in FY23.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank releases its annual report, here’s what Uday Kotak said
Description: Uday Kotak emphasized the bank's focus on digital transformation and technological innovation enabling them to provide seamless banking services to customers.

Headlines: What Uday Kotak Plans To Do At Kotak Mahindra Bank After Quitting As CEO
Description: Uday Kotak, the founder of Kotak Mahindra Bank, is set to retire as managing director and chief executive officer of the private sector lender in December this year.

Headlines: RIL, ICICI Bank among shares that MFs bought in June; Tata Motors stock on sell radar
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank (Rs 840 crore), ICICI Bank (Rs 750 crore), Reliance Industries Ltd (Rs 740 crore), Aether Industries (Rs 720 crore) and Jindal Steel (Rs 640 crore) were among stocks seeing MF buying in June.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Introduces WhatsApp Banking for Instant and Convenient Services: How to Access?
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank has launched a WhatsApp banking feature, allowing users to easily access a range of banking services and receive updates through the popular messaging app. By registering for Kotak-WhatsApp banking, customers can enjoy services such as completing their full KYC (Know Your Customer), adding funds using the app, upgrading their savings account, and applying for credit cards and loans.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Enables Linking of RuPay Credit Card to UPI Apps for Convenient Transactions
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank, in partnership with the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), has introduced a new feature that allows customers to link their RuPay credit cards to UPI (Unified Payments Interface) apps. With this integration, customers no longer need to carry their physical credit cards and can conveniently transact through popular UPI apps like Google Pay, PhonePe, and Paytm. The collaboration also offers a selection of seven RuPay credit cards, allowing customers to make payments by scanning QR codes or initiating transactions at point-of-sale terminals across the country. Additionally, customers can enjoy rewards and an interest-free credit period of up to 50 days through the Kotak RuPay credit-UPI linkage. NPCI has shared the news of this latest rollout on Twitter, highlighting the enhanced convenience and flexibility it brings to digital payments.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Customers Can Now Use RuPay Credit Cards on UPI - News18
Description: With the linkage of Kotak RuPay Credit Cards on UPI, customers would not need to use their physical Credit Card

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Empowers Customers With RuPay Credit Card On UPI, Unlock Rewards - News18
Description: Kotak Bank customers can make payments from the UPI app at merchant outlets with QR codes and POS devices across the country.

Headlines: Kotak Bank’s Arms Invests Rs 732 Crore In Rattanindia Power To Help Reduce Debt Costs
Description:
Kotak Mahindra Bank on Friday said two of its arms have invested Rs 732 crore in Rattanindia Power to help the thermal power plant operator reduce the cost of debt servicing.  	

Kotak Strategic Situations India Fund II and Kotak Private Credit Fund will be investing Rs 582 crore and Rs 150 crore, respectively, in the non-convertible debentures of RattanIndia Power, as per a statement.

Headlines: Kotak Bank Arms Invest Rs 732 Cr in Rattanindia Power to Help Co Reduce Debt Costs - News18
Description: The investment is part of an overall Rs 1,125 crore infusion by a consortium of lenders

Headlines: Indian farmers giving priority to payment of loans: Kotak Mahindra Bank official
Description: Indian farmers have begun prioritising payment of loans even as there is some degree of realisation among them that maintaining a good credit score is the key to getting finances easily, Manish Kothari, President and Head – Commercial Banking, Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd, has said.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank’s ActivMoney: Deposits with two-way sweep

Description: Through ActivMoney, excess funds in the account, beyond a defined threshold, are automatically transferred into an FD so that customers earn a higher interest on their savings.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank share price drops amid report of stake sale by Canada Pension Fund
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank shares hit a low of Rs 1,855 on BSE, but were later trading at Rs 1,891.70, up 0.28 per cent. Foreign portfolio investors accounted for 39.43 per cent of the private bank's stake at the end of March quarter.

Description: Bank of Baroda is the top gainer, up by 1.4 per cent whereas Kotak Mahindra Bank, down by 0.7 per cent, is the top loser.

Headlines: Judicial system needs to be consistent with bankruptcy law: Uday Kotak
Description: India needs to improve its judicial processes with respect to bankruptcy and insolvency in order to ensure that lenders can recover their dues and continue to lend with confidence, Kotak Mahindra Bank MD and CEO Uday Kotak said.

Headlines: Out of MSCI index, two Adani group cos tank
Description: MSCI India Standard Index has added Max Health, Sona BLW, and HAL, while excluding Indus Towers, Adani Trans, and Adani Total. Kotak Bank, IndiGo, and Zomato saw an increase in weightage, while small-cap companies ACE, Anupam Rasayan, and Gland Pharma have been added to the Small Cap index. This is expected to result in higher foreign fund inflows and a possible appreciation in stock prices.

Headlines: MSCI rejig: Kotak Bank shares may see $810 million inflows, YES Bank, Zomato other key beneficiaries
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank's weight change may result in $810 million in inflows, said Nuvama Institutional Equities in a note. The stock was trading 0.27 per cent lower at Rs 1,952.80 on BSE.

Headlines: Adani Transmission, Adani Total Gas shares may see $200 million outflow on likely MSCI rejig; Kotak Bank, InterGlobe Aviation, Zomato stocks in f...

Headlines: Kotak Bank grants first FPI license to Alchemy India Long Term Fund relocated to GIFT City
Description: Kotak Mahindra Bank has issued the first-ever FPI license for the relocation of Alchemy India Long Term Fund to India’s GIFT City, after re-domiciling it from Mauritius. The move is expected to set a precedent for other funds to consider the relocation benefits and ease of operations in GIFT City. Alchemy Capital Management plans to expand its service offerings in GIFT City after the move, which is in line with the IFSC initiative’s objective of bringing India-centric business onshore. Alchemy Group is a Portfolio Management Services provider with $770 million group assets.

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q4 Results Review - SA Accretion Remains The Key Monitorable: Yes Securities
Description:
Management has stated that Kotak Mahindra Bank would grow at 1.5-2x of nominal GDP growth rate: 
The real GDP growth forecast is 6.5% and, assuming an inflation rate of 5%, management arrives at a nominal GDP growth forecast The bank would strive to grow at the higher end of the guidance. Assuming repo rates are not dramatically lower, Kotak Mahindra Bank’s net interest margin should be at least 5%: Management explained that, on the one hand, there has been a global slowdown, whereas, in India, one needs to watch the El Nino situation.

Whereas, LIC plans to see a 30.24 per cent of its stake from its holding of 49.24 per cent in the bank.
